Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Nathalia-80
Reviews.Content: - Compared to other hotels I researched in Rome, it has a great price for what you get; - In the first stay, very large room and bathroom. (which didn't happen in the second stay, 2 weeks later - dusty room and small bathroom); - Very close to good restaurants (+- 1 block) and to Termini station (without heavy luggage). Taxis are very expensive and when you are tired, you just want a near restaurant, so this was amazing. - Safe area (lots of people walking at night - tourists); - We went walking to Coliseo, Pantheon and Fontana di Trevi (not a very short walk, but a nice one); - Large windows with nice views; - In the second night we stayed the room was very dusty and the bathroom was small (in the first night, 2 weeks before, it was a different room, clean and the bathroom was huge, as well as the room); - one member of the staff got clearly irritated when asked reasonable questions concerning the city, taxi issues (schedule) etc, or things that were of their responsibility. But it might be the way they express themselves there; - very small elevator, but worked.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Harley2007_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to find and in a good location. The room was clean and reasonably priced. The breakfast buffet was nice. Try to specify a room with a view. Ours faced out into a wall and the back of apartments. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We love ROME”
Reviews.Author: dave294458
Reviews.Content: IF ..you really don't know what hotel to choose ,try the IMPERO and no matter how you look at it there is no way you can be disapointed .The room is not large which was of no interest to us.The price was very good as the more than expected buffet breakfast,very clean,and the staff very friendly. Centrally located with direct train access from airport to Termini station only maximum 10 minuites walking time to the hotel.Also 3 minuites from bus station situated on the northern part of termini.,with connections all around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, Dark, Dull, Dissapointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaeleyK
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 2 nights in March 2012, When we arrived at 10am on the Friday we were told our room was not ready so they would store our luggage, they then gave as a map an sent us on our way !!! We returned at 5pm, tired after a long flight, walking milesd round Colosseum, and hungry, we were told a pipe had burst so they had booked us into a different hotel next door called The Flower Garden. We had to stay there one night and return to them in the morning,. The flower garden was tiny, the room had 2 small single beds, tiny shower and was dark and dull, we did get a quiet comfy night though but hadnt payed for a small twin room. Breakfast was crossients cake or cereal or slices of bread !!!! We went back to the Impero the following day as told to do so and they held our bags again as room was not ready. returned at around 4pm and our room was big and all marble but extremly cold and damp with no tv and no shower only a bath which was horrible, This also had single beds which were hard uncomfortable and wooden so noisy with even the slightest movement. At 2am we were woken by a horrific scary banging noise which frightened the life out of me but there was no explanation as to what this this could have been, could not get baack to sleep as there were noisey people in street and street cleaners! Would never stay here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: menmeg
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel so we didn't pay a huge amount for it. Consequently you don't get 5 star quality. Overall the hotel was good, it is clean, quiet and all the facilities were working. The location was good as we could walk to most of the attractions. The breakfast was quite basic and I would have liked some cooked meats. We only stayed for 2 nights and it suited us perfectly well.

Reviews.Title: “Bang Bang Bang went the noises in the night”
Reviews.Author: vegetable21
Reviews.Content: we booked 5 nights here based on triadvisor reviews, our flight was delayed because of the snow and so missed the first night (we had no idea how lucky we were) upon arriving check in was slow and the manager was in a complete muddle getting everyone mixed up, the bar area smells like an ash tray and noone serves. the real problem is the room, we were in 430, the room was tiny, no problem it was cheap but the mould pn the wall that had been badly painted over, ridiculous! the only heating in the room is from the towel rail in the one in one out bathroom, oh and the shower turns the whole mircobathroom into a wet room. what really did it for us tho was the banging, this hotel is currently dojng renovations on the 1st floor, but they only work 10am till about 5pm so not really a problem when u go sightseeing, the issue is the doors are so thin and shoddy everytimes somone open and closes a door on your corridoer you can hear it in the base of your spine! the doors provide no sound protection at all and someone getting out of the elevator and entering their room, it feels like there coming into your room! needless to say after geting very broken sleep the first night we left (having paid in full via lastminute.com) and checked i to another hotel just round the corner were we managed to resume enjoying our holiday! oh and the tv is the size of a postage stamp, but this doesn really matter as the room was the suze of a piece of A5 paper! the manager had little interest that we were leaving 3 nights early, as he had our money and there was no chance of a refund there are so many hotels in this area, dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “I am back again”
Reviews.Author: Dspbob
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent. Service staff is all Asian and polite. Roold are clean and efficient. Shower are small, no over weight persOn will fit the plastic cubical! Must try 4th floor, nice balcony!

Reviews.Title: “A good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolajc
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 3 nights at this hotel and overall very pleased with it. The location is really convenient if you're coming in on the Teravision bus to the Termini and very walkable to the sights in the majority. We were there whilst the deluge of snow came down which meant it wasn't the easiest place to get to the restaurants in central Rome (just down to the volume of snow on the ground and coming down) but at any other time that wouldn't be an issue! The room was clean, very comfortable bed with lovely fresh linen. Breakfast was a bit disappointing but you could always concoct something, who knew boiled egg and cheese spread on bread went to well :) All that said, it's a really reasonably priced hotel, good staff and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Never go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Silvia1700
Reviews.Content: The location is good...close to the metro and the Termini Station...that is about it! Dirty, old and the staff....extremely dry and rude....every single one of them. The bedroom was old and our third bed was horrible...the bathroom walls were dirty..the hallways were weird and almost scary...I was expecting to see those dead twins from the movie "The Shining" at any moment!!! The breakfast was bad...had many options of bread and pastries, but somehow they were bad. Nothing was good there, but I think my deal break was the rudeness...horrible people. I won't come back...even for free. Do not recommend it. I am a very easy going person and always try to look the cup half full....my cup was empty!!! Well, maybe it was just Rome....beautiful city.....rude, unpleasant people.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: wickosLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We bought a three night deal including flights for less than £300 per person in November so cannot be sure what proportion was for the hotel. Apart from a toilety smell in the well appointed bathroom,which I believe to be common in Rome, the deal was good. We were quite happy with the breakfast which seemed to go down well with the multi-national crowd in the breakfast room. We don't expect a full English ''sur le continent'' Location could not be better. Turn right outside the hotel and pass the Opera House and at the bottom of the road on the same side is Bar Viminale give it a try. John the owner will tell you he is number one, He also likes the English.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but no complaints”
Reviews.Author: emgeeyes
Reviews.Content: Impero is fair value, but don't expect luxury. Beds comfortable, rooms well equipped with tv, fridge, air conditioning, desk, mirrors etc. Shower a bit small, maids were excellent and flexible at cleaning at different times of day. Breakfast a little underwhelming, not the best selection ever. Location excellent for Termini station, some reviewers say it's situated near the major sights, but we went in high summer and the walk to the archeological zone with the Coloseum etc was exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “Will not book again”
Reviews.Author: mtfenek
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the Impero Hotel in Rome is the location although. There are numerous other hotels in the area and is literally 5mins walk from Termini station. It is not value for money especially where breakfast is concerned. Items offered very very limited and not fresh. Stale bread and disgusting coffee.not very clean either. Breakfast tables with stained tablecloths throughout our stay. Cutlery not clean and chipped cups re used even when attention was drawn.Rooms are old and shabby, shower rooms are even worse, cracked shower basin and towels smelt awful. Hotel needs total reburshment. Will definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Value, Clean, Quite and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Tracie1Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 brilliant nights, we were really impressed, the pictures do not do it justice... Great location walk-able to Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, it is clean and the staff were helpful, note the map they give is not to scale, your a lot nearer to everything. Breakfast wasn't great, and didn't realise how many people were in the hotel as we didn't see or hear anyone until brekkie, very continental not to my taste, but that's just me as my husband did enjoy the boiled eggs and cheeses. The lift is very small and quaint , if ever going back to Rome I would stay and I would also recommend..... BARGIN AC, Mini Bar, hairdryer, huge bathroom, and large bed

Reviews.Title: “You can get moved around to a sister hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpearLord
Reviews.Content: I can't really write a review about this hotel since I never really got to stay here, but my experience was not pleasant. I had booked this hotel for 2 nights, and the first night when I arrived to check-in, a bell boy was asked to take me to another hotel without any sort of explanation. I wasn't told if the hotel did not have rooms available even though I had a confirmed reservation, or if there was any other problem, I was just asked to walk with the bell boy. I guess even with an online reservation, you have no guarantee of getting a room. What I was able to find out was that the property owner has three separate hotels and I guess they keep moving around their guests depending on the occupancy, which is so so weird.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MandaLynne62
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely six days and nights at this quaint and cozy hotel. Our room was small with twin beds that were very comfortable. The bathroom was large and the tub was deep. Hand-held shower attachment. Small refrigerator and a safe. No frills but clean and comfortable. Lovely rooftop terrace. Our room over looked the Opera House and plaza. Loved being able to open up the room window and watch the people and traffic while winding down from a day of sight-seeing. The neighborhood was very safe - I even walked by myself one evening a couple blocks down to a local cafe for take-out panini. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast was good with large selection of breads, pastries and fruit. The evening concierge helpfully called our restaurant and made us reservations. Nice location with several shops and restaurants close by and a drug store with is called a pharmacia locally. Within walking distance to the Metro/Termini.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: gregoryA60
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and the hotel worked out fine. the front desk was always helpful and cordial, and the old fashioned keys were a suprise. The bar and dining room were nice and the food typical European fare especially being included in the price. It is a fair walk to any major tourist attractions but the metro and train station are only two blocks away and easy to use. The rooms were of average size and the beds nice and firm you forget how small the showers usually are and these did not disappoint. You will not find any ice available and the one computer was OK but no wifi available. Many restaurants around as well as the post office.

Reviews.Title: “Three days in Rome, good location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: winterblahs
Reviews.Content: Following a 10 day cruise with HAL, we stayed three nights in Rome. The price was 458 EUR or $640 CDN. Check-in at 2PM. The lobby was nice and there's a nice sitting area on the landing of the first floor. The first room we were shown, on floor two (which is the third floor) was tiny. The bathroom took up one third of the room. A small corner window with shutters looked out onto the street. There was no air conditioning to speak of. The room next door was being repaired (workers/cleaners present) and the toilet was sitting in the hallway. My linen closet is larger than the elevator. After inquiring about other available rooms and being advised that most were the same size and that is what the air conditioning is like in Rome, we were shown a room on the fifth floor, off the rooftop patio. The bedroom was about the same size as the other room and the washroom was smaller - shower only. However this room had an independent (remote controlled) air conditioner! SOLD. The elevator only went to the floor below so we had to carry our luggage up one floor. The bed was a bit hard, but we were so tired after cramming in the sites all day that it was fine. The mini-bar prices were reasonable. Breakfast was OK. Hard boiled eggs, bread, croissants, cheese slices (like kraft) and those foil wrapped cheese triangles (the name escapes me), butter, jam and coffee or tea. Skip the juice - it's like Tang. No ice to be found in this hotel. I was advised they don't use ice - they serve cold drinks. The desk staff seemed a bit aloof but warmed up and were efficient. The rooftop patio was OK. Some tables and plastic chairs (no bar service or anything like that). Internet is available but a bit pricey (and no printer available). We used an Internet Spot about a block away (booked our Vatican Tour on-line). (something like $1 EUR for 20 min. and .20 per page to print. The area around the hotel was great. Many neat restaurants a few blocks away. We really enjoyed the Ristorante Il Condor (best pizza) on Via Daniele Manin. Also the Aquila Nera on Via Principe Amedeo. The location was close to the Termini which was convenient (the Metro is in there). We had arranged a private transfer through our agent. The company was www.limoinrome.com , it was worth every penny. Charming drivers/tour guides (Luca and Claudio). We did not know that they did tours. If we had more time and $$$ we would definitely have used their services. Nothing special about this hotel (it was clean). First time in Rome so I don't have anything to compare it to. I'd probably try somewhere else if I visited again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to train station. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: 627luv2travel
Reviews.Content: Had a 3rd floor room that was nice and quiet. I loved the hardwood floors and the individual thermostat control for A/C. Hotel staff at first was a bit abrupt upon arrival, but during my stay became a bit more friendly. One must purchase a card in order to use the hotel computer to access the Internet. 1 hour is 5 Euro. The continental breakfast was basic and the serving staff worked hard to make sure food and beverage items were always replenished. The train stazion was only two blocks away. Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain are about a 20 min. walk. NOTE: Italy has now imposed a city tax for all hotels which must be paid in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtwojo
Reviews.Content: I booked this room at the last minute because my other hotel room near Termini fell through, and I had an early flight out of Rome. The price was cheap and the hotel was very convenient. The rooms were clean and comfortable enough, but the hotel was pretty drab. I would stay here again, but I would probably try to find somewhere else first. I don't think I would want to stay at the Impero for more than a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “I will go there for second time!”
Reviews.Author: chaty294458
Reviews.Content: Clean room, bathroom, sheets, functional air conditioning. The kitchen staff a little slow with serving breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel location was brilliant for all the sites.”
Reviews.Author: Alex S
Reviews.Content: Location was a 15/20 minute walk from most of the sites. Avoid the metro as myself and husband were pick pocketed there. The hotel was clean and breakfast more than sufficient. The staff were helpful and pleasant particularly one of the receptionists called Edwin. He was knowledgeable and spoke very good English. Very useful as my Italian is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and central but would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Vicky G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Impero was very close to Termini station yet was perfectly quiet for a great sleep. Our room was pretty small but clean. After reading reviews before we travelled, we did not expect the earth, but we did expect more! We would not recommend this hotel. We booked through lastminute.com who had rated the hotel as 4*, but this was extremely generous! The 'satellite TV' did not exist - there were 2 English speaking news channels to choose from. In addition, the photograph of the reception area was not of the Hotel Impero, but appeared to be of it's sister hotel a couple of buildings along the street (apparently it DID have satellite TV)! The shower cubicle did not close so the floor was soaking wet after each shower. Two large bath sheets were replaced by two small hand towels so drying ourselves was interesting! The minbar was not well stocked. No beer, no snacks. The breakfast was AWFUL! Extremely little choice, and as a result we did not venture down for the other 2 mornings. We never ventured to the roof garden so I cannot comment on this.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: emimel
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, room was nice, but the free breakfast needs a little work.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: avelocko
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for a city break in Rome. From the arrival, the front desk was welcoming and pleasant and had a little joke with us which got us off to a good start. The room was nicely furbished, tv and a comfy bed. Bathroom clean and large for the size of the bedroom. The continental breakfast was also good, a large selection of drinks, bread, pastries, cereals, eggs, yoghurt and much more! What's good about this hotel is the 5 minute walk to Termini train station. If you want a nice pizza restaurant, just turn right out of the hotel and walk for 5 minutes and there's a lovely place that is a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “i hope to return”
Reviews.Author: dylanman58
Reviews.Content: We loved this place , the rooms had everthing , air con, fridge, shower toilet etc. quiet hotel with very pleasant staff, clean rooms , a little dated but not shabby.breakfast was good , boiled eggs, cereals, bread ,cheese , juice and sweet cakes..what more do you need to start a day. Very central too ,a short walk from central station, metro 100m , and the trevi, spanish steps and other sights. plenty of restaurants and bars nearby also. the beds were really good too.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: cbarnes2280
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Impero in April 2010 and April 2011. It is not a luxury hotel but it is clean and close to the Terminal, Opera House, Coliseum, Forum and Palentine Hill. Very easy to get around. There is no restaurant in the hotel but they do have a breakfast room to get you started in the morning. Staff is very helpful. We are planning our trip for next year and will most likely stay at the Impero again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kcw531
Reviews.Content: Impero is located within walking distance to Termini Train Station, as well as the metro and bus stops. We also walked to several sights with our 4 children without difficulty, including the Colesseum. Our rooms were clean, nicely appointed, and the beds more comfortable that others we had during our trip. The staff was friendly and promptly addressed any issue we had. Drawbacks: no free wifi- you had to purchase time cards, which sometimes did not work. Also, the breakfast was one of the least appealing we had experienced on our trip: the breads and pastries mostly stale, and one morning the large pitcher of milk at the buffet was sour. Although someone had reported that the milk was sour, I did not see anyone remove it while I was there. Overall, however, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Starmanruss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, although breakfast was very basic - no cooked meats just 2 cerial choices, 3 tinned fruits and machine fruit juices. That said do not be put off from using this hotel - the staff were superb and very friendly. Our room was very clean. Just be careful using the underground and in crowded areas. We were using the underground and unfortunately someone helped themselves to my wallet and passport. Use the end of the platforms where the carriages tended to be alot emptier. Be suspicous of two women - one with a baby and one who appears to be pregnant - they work together. If the the unforgivable does happen only go to the police station in the Termini on platform 1 - they are very helpful - we were processed in one and a half hours (which was good for the Italians).

Reviews.Title: “Bad odor, though location is central. There are many hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: Claudia0708
Reviews.Content: Our room was fine until end of the 1st day. Strong odor present until room aired out. Construction, and noisey workers in hallway. Later on our 2nd day, sink filled with water, apparently by staff to control smell. Couldn't open plug so sink remained filled and was useless. Foul smell. The last day we were transferred to neareby,Flower Garden, owned by same company. Many hotels in same location near Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price, just average”
Reviews.Author: dsmulligan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome, Florence and Venice & had a package deal that included a choice of 2 hotels in each city. We picked Hotel Impero in Rome since it seemed to be centrally located (and it was - close to Termini station as well as subway/bus lines). We were not really greeted when we arrived, just given our key and told to mind the construction (there was construction on the 4th floor to the ceilings). We were on the 5th floor which has no elevator so we took the elevator up to 4 and walked up a flight. Our room was clean (besides the flies in the bathroom shower) and had a cute little balcony. As with many European hotels, the walls are paper-thin so you can hear everything in the hallway. We, unfortunately, had a rowdy American (I am American too but this guy took it to a whole new level) so we didn't sleep very well. Overall, I would say the experience was just OK. Compared to the other hotels we stayed at in other cities, this was just decent. If it hadn't been an option in the package, I would have stayed elsewhere. Pros: cheap, close to public transportation, nice rooftop deck & private balcony (for my room, at least), decent breakfast Cons: noise-level in hallways, flies in the bathroom, size of shower stall (my husband is 6'3" and literally did not fit), construction, no elevator to 5th floor (only really an issue when checking in and out)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel right in the heart of it all !”
Reviews.Author: angelina1813
Reviews.Content: Wow I was really impressed with this moderately priced hotel. The charm is unbelivable. The service so italian! The rooms were larger then all the others we've been sgtaying at in Europe. So comfortable and with a breath taking view of the Opera Theater. The windows were so lovely. I enjoyed opening them up every morning and yelling down below " Bonjourno!" LOL Seriously though it is located 5 minutes walk from Termini Station! The rooms were large, beds comfie, Bidet (sp?) along side your toilet. Just fabulous! I would recommend this room to EVERYONE. The funny thing is is that we think we got the room that is advertised on the site and that some other travlerers who posted pictures of the room because we had the exact same view ! Stay there when in Rome ..... !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: BrianHighley
Reviews.Content: Impero was a decent hotel in a very convinient location by the train station. No restaurant in the hotel, but does have a light breakfast each morning. If you're looking for luxury, keep looking. If you're looking for a simple room to sleep, this could be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nanathetraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel in a remarkably central location. Underground trains A and B are 5 mins away, as is a bus station and Termini train station (for trains from the airports). Be aware that there is almost a 5 minute walk within the station to the platform for the leonado d V express. We walked to the Colosseum, Piazza Navona and around. The hotel does a perfectly adequate continental breakfast included in the price - fruit, cereal, croissants, yoghurt, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, pastries. The room was well serviced, bed comfortable, toiletries in the bathroom, lift worked. Loads of places to eat nearby. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and friendly staff ... would have stayed longer if i could!”
Reviews.Author: lexy_herts
Reviews.Content: Myself and my mother were picked up by a lovely man in a car from the airport arranged by the hotel on our request, which is always a good start to your holiday and prevents the stresses of "how do i find the hotel" ... we arrived at Hotel Impero to be greated with a warm and friend receptionist. Our bags were taken to our room which although small was comfortable. Our room looked over the opera house next door. The only minor negative was that the bathroom was small, but who spends that much time in a bathroom???. The hotel was central to all sight, only 15 minutes or so to the Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. It was a stones throw from the republic metro which was easy (and by all accounts safer) to travel from than the termini station. We booked our trips through the hotel and we were luck enought to meet the manager who was kind enough to book a trip - angels and demons (the official tour) - which was not advertised in the hotel and printed out our confirmation papers on our behalf. Breakfast was relaxed, plenty of fruits, and continental style foods. Whilst we were there they were refitting the doorways between the breakfast room and bar, however work on this started a good while after the breakfast sessions and was cleaned up so you would never know they'd ever been working there. The only thing I would urge the hotel in improving is making more of the roof top garden which is a lovely space. It has tables and chairs to sit and enjoy the sights and setting sun of Romes roof tops but it would have been nice to have a small bar or area to have refreshments whichi think would go down a treat with guest using the hotel. The resturants near by - gioigiols and one right at the end of the same road served wonderful food, mostly full of local people and good prices. I would also recommend guests visit a small church - St Pauls within the walls only minutes from the hotel which had a free classical and westside story music night. When I return I will re book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Hotel Makes the Difference!”
Reviews.Author: MilesMinter
Reviews.Content: This hotel easily met my top 2 criteria for a hotel. #1 clean and #2 friendly. It also happened to be the least expensive hotel available from the package I booked. Even the TA tried to get me to stay elsewhere, but the Impero was blocks from the train station, the National Museum of Rome and the Baths of Diocletian and right next door to the Teatro dell'Opera, which made it the most convient hotel available and I could not have been happier. The room was the most spacious of all the hotels I used while in Italy and when torrential (and I do mean torrential!) rains caused a leak in my celing, I was quickly moved to an even larger room (with a balcony)! When my top 2 criteria are met I can easily look past the minor complaints of small showers, breakfast ect., because at the end on the day they were all fine as well. If you are looking for a clean hotel, great location in a good neighborhood with friendly and helpful staff, you need look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Impero Review”
Reviews.Author: traveler34481
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Impero at the end of March for three days. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast were Great. We were only a few blocks from Termini Station where we did get the Hop On Hop Off Bus. Our room was quiet and clean. The shower was quite small but usable. We had the best time touring Rome and did get to see the Pope for the Peoples Day Blessing on Wednesday March 30th. We found many great restaurant including Strata down the block from the hotel. We were treated well by anyone we ask for directions. We finally did see many site in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: popiel52
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fine. Clean room, ok size but a bit austere. Breakfast was just ok , but fine. Excellent location though. Front desk people very nice and helpful. I would consider staying there again if Rome was ever on my agenda again. Nice rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ckstar16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Impero in March 2011 for 2 nights. We booked this hotel through a travel package and were expecting a budget hotel with few amenities. The hotel exceeded our expectations but offered little to boast about. The best thing about the hotel is its location. It is located close to the Roma Termini and the Metro. There is no need to pay for expensive taxis. We walked to the Colosseum without too much difficulty and even walked home from the Vatican (not recommended). We felt safe walking around the area at night. The front desk was a zoo when we checked in. There were people everywhere demanding action, and the staff did a fairly good job helping everyone. There might have been a language barrier that prevented some hospitality, but all of our questions and needs were addressed. Our room was small with only enough room for the bed and a small desk. Our traveling companions, on the other hand, had a much larger room with a couch. We planned to spend the majority of our time out in the city, so the size of the room did not bother us too much. Breakfast was the typical Italian fare. There were breads, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, and canned fruit. It held us over until lunch. Overall, the hotel was fine and served its purpose. It has a very convenient location. I would stay there again as part of the travel package we booked, but I would probably try another hotel if we ever return to Rome on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Great rome Holiday”
Reviews.Author: JFAR1963
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Impero is in a prime location for whovever wants to explore Rome on foot. Close to the public trasport system, one can explore all parts of the city from this location. Room was comfoirtable and spacious. Breakfats was not thrilling but good the same. recetion staff very helpful. One could add some Tv station in English. All in all, the hotel Impero rates very good on our books. Will recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot remember how I found this place??”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: But it was just fine. Walkable from the Termini train station and close to several Metro stops (Termini and Repubblica). Quiet, safe neighbourhood for being so close to the train station. Plenty of shops, restaurants, cafes within walking distance. Room was tiny but is sometimes expected in Europe. Bathroom was nice and clean and the room served its purpose for our needs. Somewhere central to get some sleep in between checking out the sights and sounds of Roma. There is a TV in the room too. Pleasant. I am sure there are many hotels similar to this one. This one works if you are on a budget but want clean, comfortable place to sleep and breakfast in the morning (Which was OK; nothing special, but enough to last until lunch)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Impero”
Reviews.Author: angella228
Reviews.Content: Room was clean but too small for 2 people. Barely enough room for 2 moderate size suitcases. Shower too small for average size adults. The front desk accused us of cooking in the room. We offered to allow them to enter the room to show we had no cooking utensils they then stated our room smelled like medicine. When we informed the desk the hall smelled like cigarette smoke they said "nobody else is there so it should not smell like smoke". We kept feeling like we had to prove we were not cooking. Front desk NOT friendly. Inernet the most expensive at 5 euro per hour. The tax of 2 euro per night per person to be paid in cash was also a turnoff. Breakfast VERY good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Manodbff
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff, clean and excellent value for money. So what! if there's no english programs on the TV, who goes to a city like Rome and watches TV????????? Would stay there again. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faldi
Reviews.Content: The position is one of my favourites for very shorts say: very close to Termini and Via Nazionale, with a bus every 2-3 minutes. A very good breakfast and an efficient staff. The only small problema was with the escalator, a bit slow..

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a touristy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: asazk107
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in the heart of Termini, which is full of hotels and other tourist traps. The hotel itself was fine - our room was very spacious and clean, and we had a door that opened to a balcony/terrace, which was nice. The staff was fairly helpful - but don't expect the bar to be open (it never was when we were there). Breakfast was adequate but busy. A tip: If you're coming from the airport and take the Leonardo Express, DO NOT try to walk from the platform to the hotel - it's a MUCH longer walk than you'd think (especially with suitcases). It's a good hotel for the money, but I wouldn't stay in the Termini area again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: JaxLatino
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, close to Stazione Termini (Rome's main train station)i and the Rome Metro ( walking distance). So you can save money and take the express train from the airport to Stazione Termini and then walk to the hotel. The staff is a little impersonal, but polite The rooms have seen better days, but they are clean. The breakfast was OK, but the coffee was awful...ha,ha,ha. The beds are comfortable. As in many old hotels in Europe, the elevators are tiny. The bathroom was OK, with a shower, a bidet and a toilet. There was a towel warmer that worked only one night. It is walking distance to Via dei Fori Imperiali and the Colosseo.. The metro takes you a few blocks away from Vatican City. There are numerous restaurants in the area,,,and the McDonald's around the block has free wifi. The hotel's wifi offer limited (3 hours per card).

Reviews.Title: “Impero”
Reviews.Author: ACHLancashire
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location within easy walking distance of most of the major attractions in Rome. Fantastic shops and restaurants nearby. Easily accessible to all bus routes. This hotel provides a shuttle service to Leonardo Da Vinci airport (for a fee) but you will get dropped off at your terminal in plenty time for your flight - well worth it. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: OneDreamer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple visited Rome the week of Thanksgiving and stayed at the Impero. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We especially liked the night clerk wh,o when asked, recommended a nearby restaurant and suggested that we take a trip to Villa D'este in Tivoli. The Impero was centrally located, clean and convenient. I would stay there again. It is not Hilton but served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location close to Rome Termini”
Reviews.Author: rad11
Reviews.Content: Impero is centraly located, just steps to Opera Theater, close to Termini Central Station, Metro, and city buses. Plenty of restaurants, cafes, and shops around the area. Friendly and helpful hotel staff. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “don't leave anything behind and bring your own kleenex and blanket”
Reviews.Author: gwilliger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Impero for one night nov 2010. The thermostat looked like it would work but didn't, the cover on the bed was so short my feet stuck out and there were no tissues in the room (which turns out to be more common in Europe than in North America. Big long hairs in bathroom. I left my glasses behind and asked them to send them to me but they told me that although they found them and put them in the safe they would not forward them to me even if I volunteered to pay postage. Not the best customer service. Also: 3 channels on TV, all Italian and fuzzy. Oh yes...5 Euro/hr for the internet, using your laptop. Every other hotel we'd stayed in this trip the internet was free, but maybe we just lucked out. Like the man at the counter told me when I mentioned that the hotel we stayed in 1/2 a block away the week before had free internet: (the IQ hotel) "when is anything free in Rome"? I'm in no hurry to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you found a good rate is a good value for money Hotel really well located”
Reviews.Author: Coppiabrazil
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group to Rome and we choose the Hotel Impero for the location. Is centraly located on the corner with the Opera Theater and close to the Termini Central Station and Repubblica and Cavour Metro station on both lines A and B. Our room was recentely refurbished but the bathroom was still "old" with a really small space for the shower. The breakfast is good and espresso or cappuccino are for free. The reception desk is kind and helpful. Really expensive the internet connection

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, prime location”
Reviews.Author: dilberkatrak
Reviews.Content: Veru good Hotel. situated at a prime location. 5 min walk to termini station and 2 mins to the hop-on hop-off bus stop. Rooms were very clean. Good towels and linen used. Air conditioning was good. Breakfast could improve a little bit. The Old man at the reception was very courteous and helpful. Always cheerful and smiling. Made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DurhamKerry
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. We stayed in what seemed a basic and very small room, but for the price, location and views we couldn't complain. The room was very clean with an extensive balcony. Furnishings were a bit dated, as was the bathroom, but it served its purpose, which was to provide somewhere to sleep and shower. The air conditioning was a god send after many hours sight seeing in the sweltering heat around the wonderful and awe inspiring city of Rome. The breakfast was the usual - cereals, bread, coffee etc. and was a great way to start the day. Very central. At one end of the street is Termini and the other is the Via Nazionale. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again!”
Reviews.Author: diipadaapa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely a positive experience. We had two standard rooms for our family (two adults and two teenagers). Rooms were clean and simply, but nicely furnished. The air conditioning was a bit too loud, so we switched it off during the night and kept the window open instead. The breakfast concentrated a little too much on the sweet side, but was ok. I missed fresh fruit and vegetables, though. The location of the hotel was good and peaceful, although bus tickets are a good idea, since it's a good walk from all the sights. The staff was helpful and most of them spoke English. We would definitely go to Hotel Impero again!

Reviews.Title: “great room, friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: linda2960
Reviews.Content: very close to all public transportation , just a few minutes walk. Plenty of restaurants nearby , a small supermarket across the road . A rooftop terrace to relax on. Helpful staff and clean rooms. The shower is a bit on the small side but works fine. Breakfast buffet is large but on the sweet side . We had a large corner room on the 4th floor with two large windows and two terraces. The noise from the street was minimal . We had three bed and still plenty of room . I would go there again! We stayed for 6 nights and managed to do everything we wanted. Many main sights are within walking distance but the day passes for public transportation make it really easy to get around. one warning : watch out in the queue at the Vatican museums ! there are pickpockets (dressed as beggars) ...as we experienced first hand. But the authorities were very helpful with the paperwork so that was something nice in a bad situation. TIP 1 : if you visit both the Forum and the Colosseum buy your tickets at the Forum entrance. They are valid for 48 hours, good for both sights and will save you from a very long queue at the Colosseum ! TIP 2 : if you go to the Vatican museum expect a long queue , but go early and most of the queue will be in the shade TIP 3 : carry an empty water bottle with you, there are natural spring water drinking fountains all over the city ! you'll need it :) TIP 4 : if you want to get a first impression of the city before choosing what you want to see , take one of the" hop on hop off" buses. You can use them all day and they have headphones with information about the sights. TIP 5: get a good travel guide in advance if you don't want to spend money on tour guides or audio guides when you are there one disappointing sight : Circus Maximus ...there is nothing to see at the moment because they are doing works and the area is boarded up.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ecspsod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not far from the Termini train station, close to the opera, is situated in relative quite surroundings. With walking distance to most of the sites you like to see. The room we had was small but clean with good beds. Good bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Return Stay At The Impero”
Reviews.Author: Travellers94
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenaged son and I stayed here for a week in the summer of 2005. Our positive experience then prompted us (wife and I only this time) to stay here again in May of 2010. Our latest pleasant experience confirms our original 2005 experience. Very adequate rooms, a good breakfast to start each day, a small but reliable elevator. Accomodating and courteous staff at all times of the day and night. Convenient location to Termini (buses & metro lines) and several enjoyable restaurants in the neighbourhood. A supermarket a block a way and at Termini station concourse. We'll be back on our next Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyWUk
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was a bit concerned about this hotel, however we were very pleasantly suprised. The Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Termini Station and Metro so for us the location could not have been better. We arrvied and were greeted by friendly staff and were given our rooms on the top floor! The lift is fairly small but that's not really a problem. The rooms were bright, clean and spacious and had a great view of the 'Teatro dell Opera' on one side and 'Sante Maria Maggiore' on the other. Breakfast was plentiful with croisants, fruit, yoghurt, pastries, rolls, conserves etc and there was always sufficient, being regularly topped up. There are several lounge areas with lovely furnishings and a roof gartden giving fantastic views over Rome. Plenty of Restaurants nearby and only a 20 minute walk to the Colosseum. I would have no hesitaion in recommending this Hotel, Rome is obviously a very expensive place to stay so if you want 4 star then expect to pay an awful lot for it but I couldn't have been happier with my choice. I have stayed in Rome before but if I return I will go back to the 'Imero'.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel in easy location”
Reviews.Author: MrsG13
Reviews.Content: We found this a good base to explore. Close to buses/train station and tube station. Walkable distance to the Coloseum and Ancient Rome site. Found some great restaurants and bars close by. The rooms are fine, warm and clean. Could do with a refit but OK. our bathroom was fine and everything worked as it should. We looked out over other rooms but this meant it was quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: raeknight
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean and fairly well turned out. Our expectations were quite low given that it was reasonably priced and in the centre or Rome so we were plesently surprised. It's very easy to get to all of the great spots in Rome just by walking from here - well apart from the Vatican of course. The breakfast was average, but fine. The staff were friendly. All in all a good stay and we’d recommend it. Best to go out of peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: Bill069
Reviews.Content: These hotel rooms look nothing like the pictures. The lobby is nice and then the rest of the place is in disrepair. Our room had black mold and smelled moldy. The rooms were increadibly small. The service is dismal. Our luggage did not arrive on our flight and when we called the airport for an update the customer service did not speak english. We asked the front desk person to talk to them and help us. He refused, he said we needed to call from our rooms and that we would be charged for the call!!! Then he said that he was very mad that the airlines leave him responsible for finding our luggage. What ??? I would recommend another place.

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: VirpiP
Reviews.Content: location is great! Everything else is ok, not outstanding. Breakfast was little boring, same rolls, cheece and boiled eggs every morning for 5 days...but you get your machine going with that and coffee. Room was "cleaned" every day, meritanian stardards are little different from nordic countries, according cleaning. Our room was on top floor and we had also entrance to roof terrance witch was awesome! Rate was low so I think that we got value for money, one cant expect to get five star place without paying five star rate.

Reviews.Title: “THE SMALLEST ROOM WITH THE SMALLEST BATHROOM I HAVE EVER SEEN”
Reviews.Author: salonicco90
Reviews.Content: Well OK the hotels position was very good near the metro stationand the city centre but the edge of the bed was 35 points from the wall both sides and the bathroom had an 70X70 points shower area. During our stay there were workers painting the walls. Have mercy....... It should have been 1* hotel not 3*

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: mdona
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near Termini Station, small yet comfortable, clean room and especially good breakfast buffet, good service at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: Carols01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very dated and my room was quite dismal, however it was clean and is in a nice location. I felt comfortable walking the streets alone, before my group arrived, and the front desk was quite helpful with directions to sites. The breakfast was okay, nothing special but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: viviluz
Reviews.Content: Hotel well located and we had a quiet room on the first floor with AC and a bathtube so we could have a nice hot bath after a day walking all around Rome. The beds were comfortable and sheets cleaned. But the walls and carpet were not. They did not cleaned the bathtube during the whole week.... The worst thing about this hotel is it's staff. They do not care at all about the tourists. I work in the service industry and where I come from, staff like this, we don't hire ! I can not understand how they can hire people in the tourism industry who can not simply greet it's clients with a welcoming smile, and a how was your trip ???? They are not helpful at all, they don't care. They are so unwelcoming that you do not feel like asking them any information. They are lucky that Rome is a wonderful city so the tourists still going there. I dont' kwow if the hotel staff in Rome is nicer in other hotels within the same category. Maybe they just represent the Romans in general who are very cold toward the tourists .

Reviews.Title: “Way Below Par!!”
Reviews.Author: twooldsters
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week. Unfortunately. The street had a number of homeless people sleeping under doorways or on ledges. This hotel was overrun with students. We were initially located in a gloomy room surrounded by high school aged students having a great time. Mildew on the exterior wall and giggles and cigarette smoke wafting through the window/door from the shared balcony prompted us to request a different room as we had reserved for a week! We were moved to a much nicer room on the top floor. Not the cleanest, but a real improvement. Sadly, the door/window didn't work properly so we had to struggle to lock it every time we left the room. The staff knew about this, they told us it wasn't working when we moved in. They didn't repair it during the week we were in the room. The kids from all over the hotel partied on the outside rooftop deck ( right outside our malfunctioning window/door) until all hours. The only night we got a good night's sleep was our second to last night. And that was the night the earthquake in neighbouring l'Aquilla woke us at 4:30 a.m.. The frightening swaying got the adrenaline flowing! No advice from the desk on what to do here during an earthquake. Nobody answered the phone. Or even commented the next day. Directions would have been appreciated. The earthquake certainly wasn't their fault but lack of information to guests was unforgivable, especially given the size of the quake. The heat was on high and the airconditioning was off. Despite the heat wave. We have stayed in other Italian Hotels but this was the worst by far. It needs a good cleaning and service staff training. We asked for a clean, quiet hotel . The Impero Hotel did not fill either request.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderul city for both children & adults”
Reviews.Author: zoieph
Reviews.Content: this is wonderful hotel which is located very close to the central terminal. it was very easy to get around. the hotel was very elegant with its charm.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor accommodation”
Reviews.Author: KIDNEYBEAN
Reviews.Content: On arrival at Hotel Impero we experienced the most horrendous Butune smell outside the hotel which we should have taken heed of and ran a mile. Hotel reception staff were pleasent enough but once we were able to checkin to our rooms the smell hit us again.As we were only staying one night we decided to put up with the smell, but when the whole bathroom flooded when my husband used the shower we headed down to complain. Once in the reception area we noticed the ceiling being pulled down in the "breakfast room" so therefore the flooding was obviously coming through.We were not moved from or room as the hotel was full told to put towels down to soak up water. We spent the remaider of our day touring magnificant Roma and only came back to catch a few hours sleep before getting out of the dump. "Breakfast" the next morning was another experience which we should have expected given the start we had. No clean tables, no glasses, cups, food. I know a continental breakfast can be limited but that took the biscuit. Then we were in the middle off a domestic row which came from the kitchen and last at least half an hour, we really though we were in the middle of a remake of Faulty Towers. Our flight was later on that day so we stupidly left our suitcase in a cupboard in reception and were told it would be safe. On our return our suitcase was gone.The hotel receptionist had let a taxi driver load our suitcase into his taxi for other guests who were leaving the hotel. What a nightmare we had to go through to get it back before our flight departed later that day. So therefore if you want a smell free, hassle free trip to Rome don't go anywhere near Hotel Impero.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre Place to Stay - Won't go back again”
Reviews.Author: uninorth
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on our second two nights in Rome and regretted not booking again with the first hotel, 7 Kings Relais. ... The rooms are okay in an expected small European room style, with incredibly dim lighting (even if you turn on every light in the bedroom) and small bathroom layout. The first room they put us in started leaking from the bathroom ceiling, exactly where your head would be if you sat on the toilet. When we told them about it, they said they already knew about the problem, shrugged their shoulders, and handed us extra towels to mop it up. They did transfer us to another room the next day, which had a slightly better bathroom layout (and actual windows!), but with two single beds pushed together. Also, I wonder why they don't have a soap dish in the shower stall, but there's one right next to the bidet. In any case, the room was still quiet, the beds were comfortably firm, and it was what we say "a bed to get back to" after a long day. The breakfast was beyond bizarre and tasteless. The bread was stale, the eggs undercooked, and orange juice tasting like overconcentrated acid. The only thing that was good was the chocolate croissants and other pastries, and we're pretty sure those were purchased from a bakery. Everything is gone by 9:30, so if you hope to eat their disastrous breakfast, don't start late. Also, all 3 concierge clerks were minimally courteous and friendly, but seemingly detached from being helpful. When we asked about a good, homestyle, non-touristy affordable restaurant, the evening concierge directed us to two places that were very much for tourists and for pizzas or high-end fusion menus. Completely off from what we had hoped for. The only positive thing I can honestly say is that they were good enough to move us (even though they shouldn't have given the first room to anyone if they already knew about the problem) and that the proximity to the Stazione Termini was not in a seedy part of town and good enough for us to catch the airport train out with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement, but good budget hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: lagirl29
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 1-night stay in May at the Impero Hotel. We picked this hotel for it’s proximity to the train station, and the price was right as well. Staff was very nice, and spoke good English. Room was clean, but a little dark and showed some wear - the comforter had a burned hole in it, and there were some stains on the upholstered walls. There is definitely a lot could be improved. Bathroom needed some minor repairs, not to mention a place holder in a shower for your shampoo and soap. TV had some English speaking news channels. Air-conditioner worked really well, and you are able to set your own temps. The area was okay – a lot of restaurants, other hotels, and small shops; we felt safe walking around in the evening. I would recommend this hotel for a very short stay (1-2 nights), for someone on the budget and not too picky.

Reviews.Title: “Try to get a room near or on the top floor”
Reviews.Author: Robert004
Reviews.Content: After reading bad reviews both before and after our trip, I thought I would add to the opinions. Really great location if going through Termini Station, and also good for the subway (easy to navigate). We walked a lot, and took the subway for longer trips. When checking in, I asked for a room on the top floor, and got a beautiful room, with clean new bath, that opened onto rooftop deck- warmer weather may have been a problem but deck was not being used, so had to ourselves. Breakfast was not impressive but was adequate. Avoid nearby restaurant with exterior that looks like a stone silo. Found great restaurants by Trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1976kazdo
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel Impero on a hotel website after reading good reviews on trip advisor. All i can say is that they must have been staying in a different hotel. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and know what to expect in a middle priced hotel in a major city, so didnt have very high expectations, but even then was severely dissapointed. The room was dark and gloomy and extremely small. The staff were rude and the whole hotel was dirty. When we went to breakfast we could not find a clean table even though only two were occupied, the rest were covered in dirty dishes! As you can imagine we turned around and went elsewhere. On the 2nd night we awoke at 2am in complete darkness there had been a power cut at the hotel and even the emergency lighting didnt work. Thank god there was no emergency!!! This wasnt fixed untill 9am the next morning so as we had an early flight we had to pack in complete darkness. There was no apology or any explanation ( or breakfast) the next morning. All i can say is book Impero at your peril!

Reviews.Title: “Great for price”
Reviews.Author: Kirstyb8888
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews we were a little worried, however I think that some people forget that you get what you pay for. As 2 students looking for a bargain but used to cheap 4/5* hotels from friends working within the industry we were wondering what to expect from a 3* in the centre of Rome. Yes it was basic and small but it was pleasant and clean and when in a city all you want is somewhere clean to sleep, shower and change which is what we got. We stayed for 2 nights, As you first enter the hotel it is very grand and beatiful and the staircase makes it look a lot more than a 3*. the first night the room was small but clean - padded fabric panels gave the room a romantic feel. The bathroom was long and narrow and smelt strongly of damp but again, not a huge problem seen as you don't spend alot of time in your room. Shower was adequate and if you sat on the toilet sideways fine! The second night whilst getting changed the electricity went off - after an hour of trying to get back on in our room we had to switch to a different room, the second room was much larger with a much nicer bathroom which looked as though it had recently been done out. Breakfast was basic - bread rolls, butter, jam, tea, coffee, orange, pastries but again nice that it was thrown in with the price. Overall I would say a pleasant stay and a bargain for what we paid. I do think that I have quite high expectations but do like to be realistic about these things! I would certainly stay again if visiting rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central but basic”
Reviews.Author: SJMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally positioned and great for tourists. The hotel is a smaller establishment with one smallish lift that may require a couple of trips if you have largish bags. The room was clean and well heated. The bathroom had been recently re done and was superb...well except for the size of the shower. This shower was made for people who did not have arms or the need to clean their feet! The hotel did have internet but you needed to buy a card and sit in the hotel lounge. The staff were friendly and did give some advice but not very forth coming.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - did past reviewers stay here ?”
Reviews.Author: MR.23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre cruise on the Queen Victoria. Booked by travel agent. Having read so many recent poor reviews we seriously considered staying elsewhere and forgetting the cost. We were glad we went - friendly, helpful reception, lovely room with city views, perhaps a bit small but others had large rooms. Everything clean, and in working order, spotless bathroom and plenty of toiletries. Breakfast was vast with a big , regularly replaced selection - well situated , a short walk (with cases) to the main railway terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but you cant beat it for location & price”
Reviews.Author: London-Gal08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Nov 08 on a weekend trip to Rome. We chose the hotel because we needed a triple room and when I did an internet search, it came up and had a great price and was in a very central location - we couldnt believe our luck! It was ideal for the train station for getting to and from airport or other areas of Italy. And it was very easy to find on Via Viminale, right next to the Opera house. We were able to walk to the Colliseum in about 20 mins along interesting streets and the Nazionale Street is very close by. The Spanish Steps were about 20 mins away too but so much to see on the route there. Checking in and out was easy and the best thing was that we could store our bags securely after checking out to explore the city further before leaving for the airport on our final day. Our room was on the third floor was clean but small for the 3 of us but we didnt mind as we were only sleeping there and were out all day. We had twin beds and a sofabed. Perfectly comfortable. Bathroom was nicer than expected but the water was only lukewarm the first morning but fine the second morning. We didnt have the breakfast as we werent up in time but from the looks of things, we didnt miss much. We found some lovely cafe's very nearby to have breakfast. If you are more interested in location than luxury or comfort, than this place is unbeatable value.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Maverick1962
Reviews.Content: Me and my family spent there a full week in October. We stayed on the 3rd floor at room 326 with a nice view to the Opera and just a few minutes from Termini station. The good thing is the convenience it offers you to reach the sightseeings and that you can walk up and down Nazionale str. to browse in the stores. The room was ok, cleaned every day and the people were helpful enough.Saying this, the breakfast was HORRIBLE for the money you pay, there's no WIFI in the rooms and to get to the elevator you have to go two at a time. Overall I think is a good value for money 3 stars close to the heart of Rome but if you can,negotiate a price without the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowBella
Reviews.Content: Needs lessons in customer service, day manager very rude, I slipped and fell on a wet floor (cleaning the entrance to dining room at breakfast time with no warning signs) was told to be more careful. Breakfast - be down early or nothing left to eat or clean dishes, cutlery etc, rooms - shower trays overfill and flood - Beds -Comlfy , towels changed daily, Not the worst hotel in Rome I guess but could do with sharpening up its customer service

Reviews.Title: “SMALL CLEAN ROOMS .GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MRS.TRAVELS.OFTEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed there October 01 -05 on our 2 week tour of Europe. Hotel is very small, as are the ROOMS, but they are very clean. the ELEVATOR fit maybe two people ,and very slow. WATER PRESSURE - ok just be careful it switches from ice to scalding in seconds so be quick. We had ROOM # 224. our view was nice it was the view of the opera house, i was glad i was on the 2nd floor because the little place is like a maze. THE BREAKFEST in the morning is complete joke- accually its rather aweful. opt out of it if you can. the coffee is mud ,the cereal is stale , the milk is warm and yuk. i ate some sort or pumperknickle bread that i couldn't even burn the taste out. THIS HOTEL is very close to every thing. the Train Station and Subway stations are 5 minutes away the subway at 1 euro for a trip will take you to all the attractions. Colloseum, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps ,Vatican and St. Peters.etc...( MY FIRST TIME ON A SUBWAY- quick and cheap travel -awesome) they have a lot of resturants to chose from around the hotel. ,we never ate at the same place twice and i am extremely picky. dont miss out on STREGA -that place is great , just right down the road just past the opera house, we found that the last night -luckily cuz i would have definatly ate there more than once. COFFEE -i usually went to Mc Donalds -dont laugh it was the only drinkable one and it only cost 1 euro. SOUVENIERS- the best places are the little shops around the hotel, and if your looking for FAKE / KNOCK OFF PURSES, They start telling you $60.00 euros - LOL you can get them for ten here and around all the attractions ,every where else like tuscany, florence and venice went to 20.00 euros. WORDS OF ADVICE: don't take the tours, get there on your own you will see and find so many great little resturants ,gift shops and photo opts. overall; nice hotel on a buget in a great location. front desk spoke english and very helpful- they give you a great map.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonKiwidc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Sept 08. We chose the hotel because we were looking for something close to the central train station. It was a 5 - 7 minute walk to the station and easy to find. Check-in was easy and we had a room on the 4th (top floor). The room was an OK size with a mini-bar and small TV, it also had air con. The bathroom was small and your face was basically touching the towel rail when sitting on the toilet but the shower pressure was acceptable. The 2 single beds were passably comfortable and there were plenty of pillows and blankets. The included breakfast consisted of bread, bread rolls, croissants (cheese, butter and jams), plain yoghurt and cereal, along with tea, coffee and a very syrupy orange juice. You could also purchase Internet time on the provided pc in the lobby, or purchase a password so you could connect your own laptop using wifi (Although at 5 Euro for an hour it was quite expensive). In conclusion, if you're not planning on spending too much time in the hotel room and are only looking for somewhere to sleep and leave your bags then consider this place.

Reviews.Title: “its like faulty towers !!!”
Reviews.Author: dietcokefiend
Reviews.Content: the room was very small and dingy ,the shower cubicle was broken and held together with sellotape and the water went everywhere when you showered. the smoke alrm was hanging off the ceiling the room was depressing , no information povided about how to use the safe (which was in a very dark corner of the inaccesible wardrobe ) - not enough romm to wswing the proverbail cat !! the breakfast was dreadful , the orange juice looked full of chemicals , almost flueorescent !! not one bit of fruit or cold meat and coffee like mud !! the staff on reception were rude and the only thing going for this hotel was the location !! a truly naf experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Impero at your peril”
Reviews.Author: LondonSamy
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room with a bathroom. The room allocated on the second floor had a shower and a dark space in a corner with a clothes rail which was our "wardrobe". The concierge was both unfriendly and unhelpful and said that no rooms had a bath. However, after producing my booking confirmation we were given a room on the 4th floor. The bath was a shortened tub; you could not stretch out your legs (I am 5'2"). The heated towel rail was held in place with tissues stuffed into the wall at its base; the curtain rail around the bath was coming away from the wall so that the rail bowed in the middle and a large tile had come away from the bath surround which was wedged in sideways. The breakfast was basic and unwrapped in the kitchen i.e. the equivalent of Kraft Cheese slices were put on a plate; the orange/tropical juice available from a machine were two delicate shades of "radioactive" yellow and orange and even the milk took on a flavour of its own. Arriving down for breakfast at 8.45 on the third (and thankfully last) day of our stay, the bread rolls ran out completely and no alternative was offered. The lift available carries 3 people standing sideways and if luggage is involved then a queue forms. Most guests appeared to use the stairs. The walls throughout the upper part of the hotel (we had friends staying on another floor) appeared to be crumbling in parts and showed damp. The only good points of the hotel were its location; the photographs shown on various websites of the small lounge on the first floor and the inner staircase which the majority of guests used to avoid the lift. Returning to the hotel in the evening a second concierge was eating his evening meal and could not even respond to us as he was too busy chewing and chatting to a friend who was propping up the reception desk. In my opinion this hotel should never have been given 3 stars and should be re-evaluated.

Reviews.Title: “Old elegance”
Reviews.Author: DoctorKeo
Reviews.Content: Our room 332 was cheap and cheerful, at €75 with breakfast with great location I think great value. The only problem we had was the lift that only take 2 people with luggage and is very very slow - so allow extra time to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Turist12
Reviews.Content: The beautiful hotel Impero was a perfect place to stay while in Rome. Our room #104 was nicely appointed and clean. I peaked into room #120 and was ammazed by its size and amenities. There was a balcony and a fire place!!!! Request this room if possible! My only complaint was that the water in the shower did not go down well. We did not tell anyone as it was not a biggy for us. The locations is a 5 minute walk to Termini, 20 minute walk to Trevi fountain. Very convenient. ATM just down the street. Breakfast was not great compared to the other hotels we stayed in Europe, but OK for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jay018
Reviews.Content: Great location as the hotel is only a few mins away from the main train station and bus stop. The terravision bus (airport bus link) stops only 5 mins away. The area where the hotel is very safe. The other side of the termini station didnt look and feel that safe. The hotel in general was clean and safe and the staff friendly. However, this is a budjet hotel and the breakfast was very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nickolai
Reviews.Content: We had a great city break in Rome and it was made even better by this beautiful hotel. Very spacious marble lobby with period features. Our room was on the 4th Floor and overlooked the opera house and a lot of Rome. It even had a balcony. Very spacious with a wooden floor. It was a perfect romantic setting for my girlfriend and I. Breakfast was basic continental but wholesome. Overall a great hotel at a great price right next to the central railway station, retaurants, cafes and bars. The metro station was only 2mins around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: kleinGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Hotel Impero May 2008. As we were travelling thro Italy by train we had booked this hotel as it was an easy walk from station.We found older gentleman at front desk quite a character,always friendly and helpful.Bathroom tiny,don`t drop soap in shower as no soap holder,so you need to step out of shower capsule to be able to pick soap up.But very clean,and all adds to fun.Lovely balcony off room which overlooked town square,and double glazed windows so quiet ! Close to shops,restaurants and all sightseeing easy to get too.One amazing restaurant is just a few doors up from Impero at 7a/7b is a small intimate winebar called La Fontana Al Viminale(altho hasn`t got sign out front). GO THERE,and meet them all.They`ll treat you like family,and owner Ivo with son`s will look after you from their hearts.Cannot recommend this place enough.They adopt you,and will even sing for your video memories.WONDERFUL! So thanks to all for great stay in Rome. Jan and Paul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SheilaRBS
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Impero was an overall great experience. The hotel is located downtown near lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was fantastic. The rooms are a nice size, including the bathroom and are very clean. Though the hotel doesn't have a very attractive outward appearance, it is very clean and has a decent interior. Public transportation is nearby in a suitable walking distance. The area appeared to be a safe area with plenty of lighting after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Impero Rome for 5 nights in December 2007. I read several reviews on TripAdvisor before booking through hotelclub.net. I was travelling with two others so we shared a "triple" room. The room was located on the first floor and consisted of one king bed and one queen bed. The room was large, clean, airy and had its own fire place, authentic furnishings and a small balcony. The room also had air con/climate control. The bathroom was a little run down but otherwise clean. Breakfast consited of hard boiled eggs, croisants, toast, cereal, fruit juice, coffee etc.. very basic continental brekfast but still a reasonable start to the morning. The location alone makes it excellent value for money, specially the close proximity to Termini train station. I would highly recommend this hotel to new visitors, young travellers, families and couples. The hotel has a very comfy, safe, homestay feel. I enjoyed my stay and would definately stay at this hotel again. - Pablo Brisbane, Queensland, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: flynavyrn
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at Hotel Impero in Mar 08. The hotel is clean and quite acceptable. Breakfast is a simple Continental affair - coffee, pastries, a boiled egg, etc. You can, I'm glad to say, get a cup of tea! The Staff spoke good English and were very helpful. They're quite happy to give you directions and help out generally. The hotel's location is very good, being surrounded by restaurants (but don't go to the one in the round stone tower 40 yds to the left of the hotel, it's expensive and the service is poor) and within easy walking distance, if you're fit, of the attractions. The Bar opposite is OK. There's a restaurant run by the Crisciotti brothers which is left out of the hotel then right down the road almost opposite and left again. The food was much better quality and the Service was very good. I have to say though, that Rome is no longer cheap for us Brits, around £160 was the average cost for a full meal for four with wine & coffee. There's a Metro station just round the corner from the hotel and a daily go anywhere ticket is 4 Euros, if you don't want to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: CarolZgz
Reviews.Content: Location is great, only ten minutes to Termini and twenty minutes to Collisseum. Bedrooms are clean enough and staff is kind. Breakfast is not very good. Juice is horrible!! Not varied. It is not bad for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: ingopur
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located near to main station, and to the metro station "Republica" with plenty of buslines. if you have full-day ticket, this is very nice :-) we requested from our agent a room on the 4th floor as we have seen that the "lesser" rooms are smaller. We received the room on the 4th floor (416) and this is a very nice room indeed. Room was clean, the cleaning has made our beds as we left it with 2 blankets (instead of 1 common) from the second day we received 2 clean blankets and the bed was prepared accordingly. Breakfast is OK, but nothhing special, very fresh bread, a bit of honey, butter, cheese, lots of croissants and sweets, no ham. Caffee is very good, orangejuice is horrible, never seen orange, this is for sure... I would stay here also for a second time. And, last but not least, if you have the opportunity to get the room 501 -it is very large, the only room on the 5th floor and above the room is a root garden with nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Leroy_C
Reviews.Content: We had an inside room, therfore no windows / natural light. The hotel staff are very pleasent and helpful. Breakfast is provided but only a small selection to choose from. Location is excelent for Termini station, and also walking distance to the Republica area with many shops / restraunts / bars etc... Overall a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: lindaandblair
Reviews.Content: The hotel is full of charm, the staff is friendly and helpful. The room was extremely clean. The location is excellent to get to most sights. The breakfast is pretty typical continental free hotel breakfasts; rolls, hard boiled eggs, pastry, coffee and juice. Not great but good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom needs to be upgraded”
Reviews.Author: europersl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in april 2007. The hotel's location was good...however they should improve their bathroom and/or need to vacuum their rooms. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Pleasant Room!”
Reviews.Author: snoopcat
Reviews.Content: Was worried by the Hotels proximity to Termini but found it to be in a thouroughly pleasant location next door to the opera house. The room was very comfortable and seemed to be recently refurbished as it was in very good nick. The Hotel itself is in quite a grand building although you wouldn't really imagine it seing from the front as the buildings to the side of it are a little shabby. The reception staff seemed very kind and the breakfast was adequate if not very exiting. Would recomend the Hotel as the quality of service and accommodation are excellent relative to the rates charged for rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: RoyAllovertheUS
