Reviews.Content: This hotel is within two blocks of the Termini station right next to the Opera House - within walking distance of many Rome attractions. Those attractions not easily reached on foot are easily reached by bus or metro from Termini station. The hotel was clean and the room and bathroom size was pretty reasonable by European standards. The safe in our room did not work and the staff was unable to get it fixed during our six night stay - we used the safe at the hotel office. The desk staff ranged from very good to OK. All of them spoke adequate English but one had a rather sour disposition. However the rest were friendly and helpful. The sour one refused to recommend a local restaurant telling us that all in the area were good - we found his evaluation to be pretty accurate. Breakfast was served in a clean, roomy and well lighted space. The selection included cereal, bread (including danish and croissants), butter, yogert, cheese and hard boiled eggs. Internet was available at one terminal for E6.00 per hour. There was a nice sitting area on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: smileyBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from a short break in Rome. I have to say after reading other reviews on trip advisor I had my reservations about this hotel, but chose it because I got a cheap deal. We got there before the check in time, but we were still given a room. The room itself was spacious, and so was the bathroom, fully air conditioned and soundproof. The bed was really comfortable. All the staff were very helpful, and always ready to answer our questions, and helped us plan our sightseeing trips. I have to say all the reception staff spoke very good English. On the night before we came our air conditioning wasn't working, they got it fixed for us very quickly. It's in a good location, very central, with a range of shops, restaurants, cafes, market stalls, etc in the area. The locals were very friendly, and most spoke good English. Though I must say Rome is very hot in July, but I loved it, and would definately come back, and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location; basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TumorBunny
Reviews.Content: Hotel Impero is located in a very central location - the Termini. From FCO, you can take the train to Termini for 11 euros. For one more euro per person and a a 1 euro service charge, you can go to the tourist office and purchase shuttle service from FCO to the door of Hotel Impero. However, I have to warn that the shuttle service is not very friendly...nor is the ride very smooth. If you plan on taking the Trenitalia train to visit other cities from Rome, Hotel Impero makes it very convenient since it's located w/in a short walk from the Termini station, where you can catch the Trenitalia trains. Also, if and when you have to go home late at night, you can always find a bus that will go to the Termini, so you don't have to rush to come back by the Metro or waste money taking a cab. But be VERY VERY careful taking the bus...esp. when it's late at night and the bus is crowded. My friend got pickpocketed on our last night in Rome on our way home to the Termini stop. The rooms in Hotel Impero are very basic. We had 3 people in our party, so we got a triple. We stayed in room 209, which consisted of 2 twin sized beds next to each other and a sofa chair which converts into a sofa bed. The friend who slept on the sofa bed for 4 nights said that it is VERY uncomfortable. I don't know if all the triples are like that, but if that is a concern for you, you should ask and confirm before making reservations. The bathroom in our room had a very small shower stall. The water temperature was not very constant. But the bathroom overall was clean. The hotel offers a free map of Rome at the front desk; just ask for one. We found the map to be extremely helpful; wish we didn't buy our own map going to Rome. If you are thinking about buying a map for Rome, I would forget about it since you can get one for free at the hotel. Long-distance phone service was very expensive. My friend had to make a phone call to cancel his credit card. He said his call only lasted 5 minutes or so. We ended up being charged 2 euros. You can get cheaper rates for phone and internet at a nearby internet/phone station. Breakfast at the hotel was bad. It consisted of slices of bread, stale croissants and danishes, cold hard-boiled eggs, 3 choices of cereal and lukewarm milk, watered down juice, jam, butter, and slices of American cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: diamonddag
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is convenient for transport connections across Rome, being a short walk from the main Terminii train and bus station. The rooms are pretty basic and small ( we had a twin bedded on fourth floor ). In need of decoration upgrade, as our bathroom door lock was broken, and bath was cracked with dirty shower curtains. Staff helpful, but not exactly welcoming or friendly ( must be bored with constant tourist enquiries ). However, good value for money, and plenty of good cafe's and restaurants close by. Sightseeing tours easily bookable through reception desk, with pick up at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Tiger_Totty
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to the termini station – 5 to 10 minute walk depending on how fast you walk (!) and what luggage you have – managed fine with a wheelie suitcase. Would defiantly recommend getting an airport bus which goes straight from the airport to the station for about 8 euros. DON’T get a taxi unless you want to splash some cash, they charged roughly 60 euros which is a rip off for the same distance! There is just no point! Stayed in a twin room – which was very spacious – bathroom was an ok size and towels were changed daily as you would expect. Shower wasn’t very good – more of a trickle really – but it was warm and we managed fine. Room had a TV, mini bar and a sofa so as you can tell was a good size. Found it to be very quiet and we weren’t disturbed by other guests / cleaners. Breakfast was standard continental. Location was the reason I chose this hotel – with the termini only a short walk away you have the whole city at your feet……tube / tourist buses / trains. Found the staff at the station very helpful – after doing the sightseeing bus we were even able to get on local buses to go back to the same places. So it’s all accessible from this hotel. Across the street from the hotel is a café bar which is ok for a drink etc or if you turn left out of the hotel about 40 yards up is an odd looking wall and set into it is a lovely local restaurant – limited menu as its run by a small family, very small, about 10 tables at the most, has some lovely food and a gorgeous merlot all to the accompaniment of a local guitar man with all the diners singing along – in Italian so I didn’t join in! Lots of lovely pizza restaurants found by turning left out of the hotel and turning right at the café bar. We did find that some of the parallel streets around the hotel were a little daunting at night for two girls but nothing happened and once we’d explored we stuck to the busier streets. Overall would recommend this hotel – can’t beat the location and the value – but the shower could defiantly be improved. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Could be better and friendlier..”
Reviews.Author: beever
Reviews.Content: As a lot of other reviews, it is very basic hotel. We found the location great but the staffs were not helpful nor are they friendly at all. We tried to ask them for basic stuff like any restaurants we should/must try around the area or tours we can join they just replied it's our choice. which it is but could have been better if they are a bit friendlier. There were off/and on hot water supply in the hotel which is pretty dreadful. As mentioned, very basic don't expect too much. Beware of pickpockets around the hotel area as i was nearly one of the victim!

Reviews.Title: “Unfulfilled potential”
Reviews.Author: LateTraveler11
Reviews.Content: This could really be quite a nice hotel, but in the end we found it the worst of our Italian trip. The bathroom was, truly, the smallest I have ever seen, like an airliner toilet with a shower tacked on. We're tall & slender, yet I always felt as if I were balancing on one foot to barely squeeze through. The sink drain backed up, the hair dryer was broken, and the last morning the faucet developed the inability to be turned off completely. Our window on the fifth floor looked onto a dank airshaft, which wasn't unbearable because we could see flowers outside apartment windows opposite. For a day and a half there was some horrible smell, as if something had died, throughout one side of the hotel--fortunately not ours, but we had to walk through it from the elevator. Breakfast was more than adequate, the staff was helpful, the hotel was clean, and the location is very near Termini station and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “covenient, but basic”
Reviews.Author: uglybettyCountyDown
Reviews.Content: Location excellent. Had stayed in Rome before and didn't use the metro at all. This time , however, we were very close to both Termini and Republica and used them to get around. The hotel itself had a nice foyer and impressive staircase. We stayed in a triple room which consisted of twin beds and a fold out bed. The room did smell of stale smoke and paintwork needed freshing. Tea and coffee facilities would have been a welcome bonus. The bathroom was faultless and appeared to be newly modernised. We did not have any view, being on the 1st floor and found the room rather noisy. Breakfast was basic. Overall a very convenient hotel for transport and sights, but with very few luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Impero - a great find for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Budgettraveller35
Reviews.Content: Ideally located for transport links but still within easy walking distance of the attractions. Clean, airy room on the 4th floor with a great view of the Opera house. £60 a room per night with breakfast - not bad for a city centre!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: NYCviews
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room that had two (2) twin beds and a sleep sofa. It was located in the front corner of the hotel with 2 exposures, the side window had a great view of the Opera House and the front window faced Via Viminale. The room was a good size, very clean and nicely appointed. The bathroom was huge, especially for European standards. The staff were all very polite and always helpful when asked, and the continental breakfast was more than adequate. There was a beautiful area on the floor above the lobby where guests could relax, access the internet, etc. This is a PERFECT area for convenient access to almost all tourist attractions and the main railway, Termini. I would highly recommend Hotel Impero to my family and friends and I will stay there on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mf012e
Reviews.Content: The location and price of hotel were the best features. I wouldn't stay again. Smallest bathroom/shower I have ever seen and I have seen some small ones in NY! Neighborhood a little questionable at night. Close to termini station and to metro stops. Staff....okay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Superbo”
Reviews.Author: Ticklin'Jock
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights from 18 - 23rd January. For the low price we paid for this hotel the rooms were excellent, clean and the staff were very friendly. The breakfast was perhaps a little restrictive in choice but sufficient to give you a good start to the day. The location of the hotel also suited us well. A 10-15 minute walk took you to the Colloseum area or a 20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. The Metro stop was also handy and Termini was a few minutes walk away. If you fancy a late night drink close-by try the Washington Snack Bar across the road from the hotel. The waiters were very chatty and entertaining compared to some other places we went to. When we go back to Rome we will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugDevon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July 2006. When we first arrived it was well after midnight but we shown quickly to our room by the night porter (who spoke 4 languages!). The room was a decent size with very high ceilings, comfortable bed, very clean and with air conditioning. The bathroom was immaculate and fairly small, but about average size for a budget hotel. The hotel is very centrally located, near to the Termini bus station and several Metro stations so it was really easy to get to all the attractions. We walked to the Forum and Colosseum which took about 20 minutes. There is a small supermarket type shop just down the road also and plenty of restaurants nearby. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel as it is very good value for money and in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay at the Impero”
Reviews.Author: bonnieIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 nights stay at he Impero Hotel, stay ed in room 426 from what rooms we viewed this was the best room in the hotel, we were allocated a room on the 2nd floor, but having read the reviews on tripadvisor before going, asked for room on the 4th floor, on checking in, front desk a bit grumpy about it, but if you dont ask you dont get... beds very comfortable, a bit on the small side, The linen was changed every day, and nice large bath towels., plenty of hot water, and overall very clean. The staff were not the most friendly, but that did not worry us. Breakfast was just O.K. but knew this before staying, We found that we had to be on guard with over pricing in restaurants, but good value overall. One place to be avoided at all cost is the BAR WASHINGTON right across the road from the hotel, did read about it on trip advisor before, but just forgot till we were landed with a bill. very friendly waiter in red jacket stands outside and to entice you in, place empty most of the time, our bill for a local brandy, gin and tonic, small beer and a tonic water E33, got the same in much nicer bars for E14, othe diners there that night were far from happy with their bill, when we questioned the amount, we were told that if we found it expensive, 'others did not 'more or less saying that we were tourist on a budget.... I mean this place is anything but flash. We just dont like to be had, this waiter was over us like a rash till we complained We enjoyed rome very much, Hotel Imperio could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was ok, good location”
Reviews.Author: Light-cruiser
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Impero Hotel during our visit to Rome. The hotel was small and there was renovation going on at the main entrance of the hotel. The room was clean but the furnitures were a bit old. The bathroom was clean and not too small, just nice. We had a very attentive waitress during breakfast. Overall, it is clean and we have no complaints except that the lift is tiny that it barely fits 2 persons!! It is near Termini Station and I consider that a good location.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok!!!”
Reviews.Author: gregov
Reviews.Content: This is a low-budget Hotel that tries hard. It is only 5 min walk from Termini Station, a little far from best attractions. But it is close tothe National Museum(across street). Room was adequate but shower was tiny, I literally could not bend over, and I am not a big person. Room had broken shower head and shutters that flapped in the wind. Breakfest was bread and juice and coffee. Also there were hard boiled eggs.But with all of that said, it is a clean establishment that caters to the low budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Milo2
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a Three night stay at the Hotel Impero, it was a great budget hotel. The room was modern & clean & the breakfast was good too. The Hotel is centrally located & very close to a metro link & the Termini station. I think you would be hard pushed to beat the value.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: lesiss
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Impero for three nights. The customer service was terrible. On our second day our shower was leaking onto the cieling of the room below us. Two workers came to our room to look at it and then they left. We went sightseeing all day and when we returned at night, things were moved around in our bathroom. It appeared that someone had used our shower/bathroom, even our toothbrushes were out of their containers and dirty. We informed the staff and they didn't even believe us. The following night our safe wouldn't work; we had to leave for the airport at 4:30 a.m. and our plane tickets were in the safe. The hotel staff said they didn't have a master key and there was nothing they could do for us. They didn't even make an attempt to help! We ended up finding some man who didn't even work at the hotel to help us. We finally got the safe open 3 hours later. I wouldn't stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great loction”
Reviews.Author: maryann3
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from a four night stay at hotel Impero rome,on first floor looking over the Opera house.A little noise at night,but been in the centre of Rome I think where ever you stayed it would be the same.room small but cosy and air conditoned,bathroom quit big,clean,towels changed everyday,sheets on bed changed while we were there,mini fridge in room,tv no englise channels but then we were not there to wacth tv,security box which was handy.If you get to Rome early they will let you leave luggage before cheak-in and after check-out.Breakfeast good,go up as much as you want,bread,rolls,cereal,soft&hard cheese,hard boiled eggs,hot if you are early,sweet pastries,some warm,juices,tea&coffee.Staff friendly,they all spoke good english.good access to temini (all transport) turn left outside hotel,keep walking up and across and you will come to it,some shops are there.most tourist sites are within easy walking distance,if you are not able it can be hilly in places.we took the red open top bus 110 for a siteseeing tour at night which was great,you can do it in the day and get off at places,cost 13eros each,if you stay on it takes two hours.Plenty of local restarants around the hotel,and supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but if you have a better choice, go for it”
Reviews.Author: gadaha
Reviews.Content: Location is OK for those wanting to be next to the main train station, but other than that the area is not a nice area. The Hotel is OK, but just OK. We stayed at the 5'th floor, and the room was decent. The elevator doesn't get to the 5'th floor, and you need to go to the 4'th and climb the stairs. Room was Clean, but the hot water in the shower works off and on if you use it in the morning in parallel to everyone else taking a shower. The breakfast is only so so. It takes about 25 minutes to walk to the more interesting parts of the city, although there is a metro station close by, which can be used to go to, for example, the Vatican. To sum-up: the hotel is very expensive for what you get, but these are the prices of hotels in Rome; if you have a better choice, go for it; otherwise, don't expect much and you won't be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good price”
Reviews.Author: Thomas53
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Impero through on of those online hotel sites, and got a relatively good deal: 90 € a night right next to the main train station. Although Rome is not an especially large city, we did save a lot of money on public transport by being able to walk to all of the many sites in Rome. Impero is pretty much right in the middl of the Rome attractions, which means that we were about a mile's distance from both the colosseum and St. Peter. So we could do Greece one day and the Renaissance the next with little increase in energy. Rome is hot in the summer and it helps to not have to walk as far, particularly in the middle of the day. Impero's breakfast was nothing special, but was good enough to get us going in the morning. The staff was friendly and got a little kick out of my repeated attempts at murdering their language. Everyone spoke good English though so there were no problems communicating. The rooms are very small, but cozy (and Air Condiitoned!) and despite the central location, there was little noise at night. A good deal and a nicely run hotel for the traveler who realizes that spending a little more on the hotel can save a lot on public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: kristileigh
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i spent the first two nights of our italy trip at this hotel, and it turned out to be the least impressive of all the hotels we stayed in...the first room we were in had the worst bathroom, and the shower door kept falling down..they gave us a different room when we complained, but the room wasn't great...the area is ok, not great atmosphere though...kind of like staying near port authority in nyc...i would recommend spending a little more to stay in an area with better atmosphere...maybe near the spanish steps...of all the places we went to in italy, rome is the only place you really need to spend money to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean3
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four day stay at the Hotel Impero and I think you would be hard pressed to find a better budget hotel in Central Rome. The rooms were clean, staff very helpful and the location couldn't be beaten. I only had to use public transport on one occasion (attending football match at Olimpico Stadium). The Spanish Steps, Colosseum/Forum, Fontana di Trevi and Pantheon were all within walking distance (1km) from the hotel. To reach the Vatican, you will need to get the Metro to Ottaviano. If you do wish to use Public Transport - A Days Ticket incorporating Metro (A & B Lines), Buses and Trams only costs 4 Euros. There are numerous bars and restaurants in the hotel vicinity and I felt totally comfortable walking (staggering!) back to the hotel after a night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money paid”
Reviews.Author: YoungAnneYoung
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor member Skipton Yorkshire. Stayed for 3 nights at The Impero Hotel with 2 girl friends (although a little older than girls!!!. We found the hotel to be in a good area and felt very relaxed and safe, The Hotel staff were extremely sweet and helpfull. Breakfast was also good value for the inclusive price we paid. Coffee was delicious. The hotel rooms are basic but very clean and beds are comfortable. Rooms are cleaned daily and used towels replaced for clean. The lift is small for three people only but I found this useful at night for propping my friends up fiollowing a two bottle of wine lunch and several cold largers later!!!!!! and sneaky noggins inbetween !!! Thankyou to my frriends J and C who found this hotel after many hours of painstaking searching on the Internet and also for making the stay so memorable and so much fun. One last comment we were all very impressed with the Chinese Restaurant next door but two , who offered a choice of three dishes for inclusive price of 7 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in mid June. The room was clean and simple, the bathroom was lovely at first, but then you notice the little imperfections. Every time we showered the area around the toilet would leak. No matter though, because you only sleep there. The room safe was great and very modern – you choose the code. We were on the first floor (second floor in NY), and had a great view of the opera house. The location cannot be beat. Close to Termini (train station) it is extremely accessible for both entering Rome and traveling within (lots of buses terminate there). For the tourist attractions we found the #40 express bus to be very handy when heading back to the hotel late at night. One caution for the airport train – plan an extra 15 minutes for the walk between where you enter the train station and where you actually get on the airport express train. We just made it. Breakfast is so so – bit on the stale side and not much selection, but there’s plenty to eat around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: pinky71
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from March 13th to 16th.-Close to the main station and very central.Infact we did the whole of Rome by foot except going to Vatican City which was by metro.The rooms are alright and surprisingly the bathroom was very nice and modern.Breakfast was standard fare but sufficient and the head waiter was cheerful and smiling! Be prepared to walk around Rome - would recommend this hotel. The rest of Italy we did on the train which was convenient and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Floor Walk up”
Reviews.Author: Clear213
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Impero in Rome, Italy. There were multiple problems with the room. Some were corrected. Some were not. Problems included broken toilet seat, floating drapery panel, clogged shower drain and faulty elevator. The biggest problem was the off again on again elevator. There were promises that the elevator was being repiared. Desk clerk couldn't hear that walking up four flights of stairs might be a problem for us. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 8 days at the Impero Hotel. A great location for transportation from the Termini Station as well as for walking to many major attractions. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Room for 3 was better than many I have stayed in. Bathroom small but adequate. Many restaurants in the neighborhood, Tudini on Via Cavour especially good ,friendly staff. Avoid the American Snack Bar across the street - waiter spilled red wine on my sweater and never even apologized. Couldn't have asked for a better stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Even more Prego”
Reviews.Author: mike3
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Rome again during mid-March. Last year stayed at the wonderful Hotel Morgana. This time stayed at the awesome Hotel Impero. The location cannot be beat. It was in the middle of the city centre, right next to the Rome Opera. There is a metro stop very close by. The rooms were a decent size (actually, large for Europe). The were very clean and the bathrooms seemed to be recently renovated. The windows are made to keep out the outside noise. The maids always did an excellent job of cleaning the rooms. The breakfast buffet was very nice. Breads, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, cheeses, juice, coffee, and sweet breads. All that was missing was meat slices. The hotel lobby was beautiful in an old European way. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with a group of 10 women and found the hotel Impero to be in a great location to all the main attractions of Rome. The hotel was lovely. The bedrooms were clean and airy. The breakfast was lovely and you could have as much as you wanted. The staff were helpful and friendly. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JohnD44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for nine nights in March 2006 and absolutely no complaints. Comfortable room with balcony overlooking the main street,(4th floor rooms only) double glazing kept out the noise at night. Air conditioning, small but functional bathroom, mini fridge and security box in room. Breakfast from 7am to 10am nothing spectacular but more than adequate, fruit juice, cereal, bread rolls, cheese, boiled eggs, pastries, tea, coffee. Nice and central for all of the main attractions and close to both Termini and Republica metro stations. Lots of excellent trattoria and restaurants in the vicinity, particularly Restaurant Giglio around the corner in Via A. Depretis. Would stay here again no problem

Reviews.Title: “i hate this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RosanaSpinelli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Impero, just for one night (thank´s God!). We moved to Hotel Sistina in the other morning. The room was tiny, tiny and tiny, without a view, and everything seems dirty. The bathroom was a bad dream, just like a shower. The bed was a shoe box. I hate this hotel and I´ll never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: farranfore
Reviews.Content: We had a treble room on the 4th floor with a view of the Opera Theatre which was clean and spacious enough with a nice bathroom. Sheets and towel were changed each day. Breakfast was the usual bread, eggs, cereal, croissants, juice coffee which was what you would expect. It is very central being only 20 minute walk to Trevi fountain, spanish steps etc. It is only a 3 minute walk from Termini but on a nice quite street which was very handy when you got off the bus from the airport. The weather was great around 15 degrees in early March. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable clean rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: bazftm
Reviews.Content: Myself and 13 of my friends stopped in the hotel for the Italy England Rugby game as it's location was central for all of the sights of interest, close to the Termini rail station and metro or bus stations. The hotel satisfied all of the above criteria being only about 5 mins walf from the Termini and 15 mins walk from the Coloseum, Roman Forum, Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. With the Vatican being on the other side of the river this is a bit further away. The rooms were clean but variable in size and the bathrooms were all of an acceptable standard. Some rooms were better than others and probably the best room of the seven we had was 120 which was large and had some interesting internal features. As a rule the rooms on floors 3 and 4 were slightly bigger and better than those on the first or second floor. As for Rome itself, It is a nice City with a good range of interesting sights but no where near as good as the likes of Prague, Barcelona, or Budapest.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustineLow
Reviews.Content: 2 important factors made us choose this hotel, the location and those positive reviews we read here. Personally, I think it's worth staying in this hotel if you don't want to spend too much in accommodation. It's just 2 mins walk from the Termini station whereby you can get any bus (regular bus or tourist bus), train and underground to anywhere. Anyway, the best form of exploring the city is by foot. The only time we took a public transport was to go to Vatican as we wanted to be there as soon as possible (early in the morning) to avoid the crowd. There are so many things to see all along the way so you don't really find it far to walk to most of the tourist attraction sites. Everyday we walked to everywhere, such as Colosseum, Fourm, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Piazaa di Spagna, Santa Maria Maggiore, etc. etc. and then back to the hotel every night. Now, let's talk about the hotel... The reception staffs can speak perfect English, so we have no communication problem with them. We were given room 431 and it's right next to the lift. We were worried that it might be noisy but it was not. The room is clean, not really as small as we expected and it comes with a safe box too. The air conditioning works very well and silently. The bathroom is on the small side. When I sit on the toilet bowl, my knees were touching the shower stall so in the end I use it side way... hahaha... It took me quiet sometime to get the right temperature for the shower for the first time but after that it's ok. The breakfast is of limited choice, hard boil egg, pastries, bread, juice, milk, coffee, etc. But it get us started for the day. The hotel has no problem keeping our luggages for us after we check-out in the morning at 9am (check in/out time are at 12 noon) and only back to the hotel at 4pm to collect our luggages. At the same time we can go to the first storey of the hotel to have a little rest in the resting hall, to freshen up, etc. Overall, we have a great experience here. Don't mind going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but basic”
Reviews.Author: Dall
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good location for people who like to walk most sights a good distance away. Stayed in room 221which had no view at all. Quiet airconditioning but no safe in the room as stated ! . Room was clean but small. reasonable sized clean bathroom. the staff were not friendly at all and did not greet us nicly or wished us any pleasentries on our departure. The breakfast was cold buffet. No fresh fruit and only diluted juice, but it got us by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oscar Brian
Reviews.Content: We`stayed for three days in November and found it to be a really good value budget hotel. Good location, bedroom a little small but very adequate, excellent bathroom and quiet location. Breakfast was buffet style - bread, pastries, eggs, cheese etc - a good start to the day. Plenty of local restaurants to choose from and well located for metro and bus routes

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great value hotel just 5 minutes walk from the termini, which made it ideal for getting to all the sights. The room was ok although a bit dark - the only window in our room looked out onto the yard area and wasn't at all scenic. Breakfast was adequate with a choice of pastries,rolls and cereals. Oh, and you could also get a boiled egg!! If you want a snack, the little shop up the road with the pig hanging by the door makes a great pork sandwich for 2euros. Basically, if you want a good budget hotel in Rome then there are an awful lot worse than the Impero.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: LiseyLou1
Reviews.Content: The Impero Hotel in our opinion was excellent value for money and extremely quiet. The decor was clean and fresh and the surrounding area was not at all seedy or unsafe at night. We managed to get a room on the top floor (422) which had a shared terrace and balcony for 4 rooms which has excellent views of rome from here. The room itself was small and compact but was very clean and had everything that you would require for a short stay in Rome (the shower, however,was extremely small). The reception staff, breakfast staff and cleaners were extremely friendly and happy to help! The breakfast was just as we expected for Italy and if you love pastries you will have no problems. Reception let us leave our bags for the afternoon after we checkedout for no charge and even rang us a taxi for the airport. I would recommend the Irish Bar on Via National which is around the corner, out of all the traditional Italian places that we ate at in the surrounding area this was the best! Also much better value for money! My only negative comments would be about the bar in the reception area which is barely used, therefore,the staff do not know what the drinks are or indeed how much they are. I would suggest buying your own from any of the local shops and putting it in your minibar! Overall i would highly recommend the Hotel Impero and would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleWeekender
Reviews.Content: Hotel Impero is a GREAT value. We moved there after checking out of a horrible dive near Termini called Hotel Giorgina - Avoid Giorgina at all costs! Our room at Impero was only 20 Euros more a night and WOW- what a difference! Impero is near Termini and easy walking distance to all the sights, but located on a slightly less crazy street than many Termini hotels. Our room and adjoining bathroom were just lovely. Charming, spotlessly clean, sparkling bathroom, quiet. The shower stall was very small, but we just laughed about this and got on with it- A small price to pay for such a great place! When you book, be sure to ask for a room on the third floor or higher for the best stay. We were in room 420 and highly recommend it. The only poor rooms in this hotel are the ones on the first floor that haven't been updated yet. The breakfast was fine by Italy hotel standards and the staff was pleasant and helpful. We would stay at Impero again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LisaMM99
Reviews.Content: Hotel worked out perfectly for our 3 days in Rome, it is in a greatlocation to either walk or take other transportation to the entire city. Several restaurants within the area that were good (rooftop terrace one on same side of street walking towards the Termini was worth going back to), not as high priced as in other places. Area was safe and quiet at night. Breakfast was decent, enough to get you through until lunch. Desk staff was helpful with letting us know how to get around the city. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont use the Washington Bar Opposite”
Reviews.Author: ajames10314
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Impero for nights recently and found it to be OK. Well placed for the train station and a quiet street compared to most. Easy to walk to most places apart from the Vatican. There is a bar on the same side of the road (sorry dont know the name) past the Hotel Columbia and before the roof top garden restuarant where the staff were very welcoming and the drinks reasonably priced - lovely people, please pay them a visit. DO NOT go to the Washington Bar opposite - they charged us 8 euros for a measure of local brandy and 4 euros for a can of coke. Even the italians eating there complained about the food. Nice restuarant in the street to the left and down some stairs - go there for a taste of Italy at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go There”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very small and dark rooms, poor breakfast (food selection not very appealing and dining area smelled of mold from early morning mopping instead of day before), and staff wasn't very friendly. Bedding smelled dirty and old. Lots of nicer hotels in this area near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and a good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights beginning September 8, 2005. Very clean, nice folks, centrally located right next door to the Opera and a block from one of the major museums. Two blocks from the train station. Ice is available from the staff. So-so breakfast. Refrigerator and safe in each room. Pretty quiet for a Rome hotel. One very nice restaurant right around the corner, directly opposite the Opera house. Try the squid in balsamic vinegar! A nice trattoria is located out the front door, two doors to the left. A really good restaurant (says it is Chinese and has great, low cost Italian and Chinese dishes) is next to the trattoria. Dinner of three courses and a bottle of wine was 30 Euros. Two gripes: sewage smell comes from the shower drain (we covered the drain with the plastic wastebasket when not in use), and the toilet seat was broken and very uncomfortable. Management didn't have a replacement seat. I'd stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for money & Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although nothing great from the outside this hotel was great value for money. The staff are friendly, the hotel is clean and the air con was a god send. It's well placed, just a 5 min walk from the main train and bus station and ten mins from the main centre. Its close enough without being in the heart of the hussle and bussle. The breakfast was the usual self service buffet of bread rolls, cheese, butter, jams, some cereals, fruit juice, tea & coffee nothing to blow the mind. I didn't experiance the hotel meals so I can not comment on them. Although I could nit pick about a few minor point I will not as it will take away merit from a great budget hotel. What I will say to anyone going to Rome, watch out for the young local children near the bus & train station. They look sweet enough but as we found out some are pick pockets. Luckly we caught them in time!!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE, GOOD LOCATION, RECOMMENDED!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers94
Reviews.Content: Very close to Termini train station. You can walk to the hotel in 10 min from there. Very close to metro lines (Repubblica and Termini) and to main bus depot...you can get to anywhere in Rome fairly quickly at a very reasonable price. Right near the Opera House. Very friendly staff, especially front desk and Pepino who seems to be a man of all trades!! Room well airconditioned and adequate (4th floor). Good elevator. In a busy area of the city, but location is quite quiet. Breakfast continental but most adequate. My family (myself, wife, teenager) stayed here for a week in August. Good value, good price. Explore this hotel as there are some very nice features that we did not see at first because of where we stayed. Nearby supermarket and snack bars were handy.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Impero
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Viminale 19, I-00184 Rome, Italy
